  sgcool_label_text: This was a performance put up by the Singapore Federation of Chinese Drama Association. The performance was about the Singapore River
 which was held in conjunction with the celebrations of Singapore’s 25th year of independence. The performance was held at the Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall
 one of the oldest performances spaces in Singapore whose origins can be traced to 1909 when it first opened. It was originally known as the Victoria Memorial Hall – in memory of Queen Victoria – being being renamed Victoria Concert Hall after renovations in 1979.\r\n  This was a performance put up by the Singapore Federation of Chinese Drama Association. The performance was about the Singapore River

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This was a performance put up by the Singapore Federation of Chinese Drama Association. The performance was about the Singapore River, which was held in conjunction with the celebrations of Singapore’s 25th year of independence. The performance was held at the Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall, one of the oldest performances spaces in Singapore whose origins can be traced to 1909 when it first opened. It was originally known as the Victoria Memorial Hall – in memory of Queen Victoria – being being renamed Victoria Concert Hall after renovations in 1979.
  This was a performance put up by the Singapore Federation of Chinese Drama Association. The performance was about the Singapore River, which was held in conjunction with the celebrations of Singapore’s 25th year of independence. The performance was held at the Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall, one of the oldest performances spaces in Singapore whose origins can be traced to 1909 when it first opened. It was originally known as the Victoria Memorial Hall – in memory of Queen Victoria – being being renamed Victoria Concert Hall after renovations in 1979.
